_exec_summary.SummaryText:
DELPHOS CO-OP ELEVATOR ASSN. IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS WHICH SELLS ANHYDROUS AMMONIA TO AREA CROP PRODUCERS.  THE FACILITY HAS (1) 26,000 GALLON STORAGE TANKS WITH A TOTAL CAPACITY OF 114,000 LBS. THE FACILITY ALSO HAS (28) 1000 GALLON NURSE TANKS FOR A TOTAL NURSE TANK CAPACITY OF 123,200 LBS.  THE TOTAL FACILITY CAPACITY AT ONE PARTICULAR TIME IS 237,200 LBS.  THE TANKS ARE DESIGNED AND MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL APPLICABLE  LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS.  THE FACILITY HAS ALSO PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES WITH THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT-TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III (EPCRA).  THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR TANKS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND WE COMPLY WITH ALL OF THEIR REQUEST FOR IMPROVEMENTS.

THE COMPANY HAS INSTALLED AN EMERGENCY SHUT OFF VALVE ON THE 26,000 GALLON STORAGE TANK. THE EMPLOYEES AND LOCAL RESPONDERS HAVE BEEN TRAINED ON HOW TO USE THE EMERGENCY SHUT OFF VALVE IN CASE OF A  MALFUNTION OR COLLISION TO DOWN STREAM PLUMBING.

THE WORST CASE SCENARIO WOULD HAVE A TOXIC GAS RELEASE OF 114,000 POUNDS OF AMMONIA, THE DELPHOS COOPERATIVE ASSOIATION HAS CORDINATED WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND THE COUNTY EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT ON THE EMERGENCY PROCEDURES.

THIS COMPANY'S POLICY HAS BEEN TO TRAIN EMPLOYEES IN THE SAFE HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA ON A REGULAR BASIS.   THE EMPLOYEES WHO WORK IN THE AMMONIA PLANT ARE TRAINED IN THE SAFETY INFORMATION, HAZARDS, OPERATING PROCEDURES AND THE MAINTENANCE PRACTICES OF THE TYPICAL FACILITY.  THE EMPLOYEEES ALWAYS WEAR GOGGLES AND THE APPROPRIATE GLOVES WHILE FILLING NURSE TANKS.  ABOVE ALL, THEY MAKE SURE TO HAVE CLEAN SAFETY WATER ON HAND DURING  AMMONIA OPERATIONS.   OUR SAFETY RECORD  ALLOWS US TO PROUDLY REPORT THAT THERE HAVE BEEN NO INJURY ACCIDENTS AT THIS PLANT IN THE LAST FIVE YEARS.

OUR EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN IS SHARED WITH OUR THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT.  THEY ARE AWARE OF THE DANGERS OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.
THEY'VE ALSO AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY.
